info.name: Atomic Financial API
info.description:
Documentation for the API surface of the Atomic Financial Public API.

# Postman Workspace

## Structure

This Workspaces is grouped into folders. Each folder contains related functionality, which you can use to explore areas of the API:

- creating an access token
    
- using our company search to create a typeahead experience
    
- userlink or employerlink data integration
    
- continuous access via linked accounts
    

Each folder will have information in the documentation page of the folder detailing what is possible with the Requests in that folder.  
There are many requests which take advantage both collection level and environment level variable. Some even have tests which will grab data from a response and store them in the appropriate variable for reuse. The environment variables are limited to data which will be environment specific; urls, api keys and secrets, tokens, etc.  
We have provided both a Sandbox and Production environment which contain all variables we have used to create the Workspace.

### Getting Started

1. Get your API key and secret for your environment from the \[Atomic Console\]([https://console.atomicfi.com](https://console.atomicfi.com])).
    
2. Store these values in the appropriate environment variables for creating an access token and any API requests which can be made using the API key and secret pair as opposed to the publicToken.
    
3. Run the Create Access Token Request to populate the `publicToken` variable in order to set this value for future calls to the API.
    

### More information

You can find more detailed information on the \[Atomic Financial Docs site\]([https://docs.atomicfi.com](https://docs.atomicfi.com)).  
Please leave comments here in the Workspace if you have any questions or concerns.

item.name: Access Token

header.description: API Key for your Atomic account
API Secret for your Atomic account

request.description:
# Create an access token for direct deposit

Generates an access token that will automatically become invalid after 30 minutes.

## Header Values

- `x-api-key`
    
- `x-api-secret`
    

These values are available in the [Console Settings page](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/credentials) under Credentials.

## Body Values

#### Required:

- `identifier` - unique ID from your system - UUID or other
    
- `accounts.accountNumber` - account number for the end user's account for deposit allocation
    
- `accounts.routingNumber` - routing number for your institution
    
- `type` - one of `"checking"` or `"savings"`
    

#### Optional:

- `title` - title for account type or other data about account
    

## Variables

This request runs a test after successful completion which stores the `publicToken` in an environment variable to be used in subsequent requests.

header.description: API Key for your Atomic account
API Secret for your Atomic account

item.name: Create Access Token - Deposit - Multiple accounts

header.description: API Key for your Atomic account
API Secret for your Atomic account
API Key for your Atomic account
API Secret for your Atomic account

request.description:
## Usage

This endpoint makes a call to `/access-token` to create a publicToken for a Deposit use case.

The Test in this Request then grabs the publicToken from the Response, stringifies and base64 encodes a config object, and builds a URL. This URL can be used to instantiate Transact. It is printed to the Postman Console and stored in the `transactUrlWithToken`environment variable. Copy and paste this string into the URL bar of a browser to launch Transact.

This is very useful for testing variations of the config object and launching Transact outside of your application.

## Usage

This endpoint makes a call to `/access-token` to create a publicToken for a Verify use case.

The Test in this Request then grabs the publicToken from the Response, stringifies and base64 encodes a config object, and builds a URL. This URL can be used to instantiate Transact. It is printed to the Postman Console and stored in the `transactUrlWithToken`environment variable. Copy and paste this string into the URL bar of a browser to launch Transact.

This is very useful for testing variations of the config object and launching Transact outside of your application.

item.name: Create Access Token - PayLink JIT flow

header.description: API Key for your Atomic account
API Secret for your Atomic account

request.description:
# Create an access token for PayLink Switch Just-in-Time flow

Generates an access token that will automatically become invalid after 30 minutes.

## Header Values

- `x-api-key`
    
- `x-api-secret`
    

These values are available in the [Console Settings page](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/credentials) under Credentials.

## JIT Variaton

This version of the API will instantiate Transact even though the required details to make a switch haven't been passed to Atomic yet. Listen for the `onDataRequest` clientside event to trigger the follow-up API call to hit the PUT endpoint on `/user`.

## Variables

This request runs a test after successful completion which stores the `publicToken` in an environment variable to be used in subsequent requests.

header.description: API Key for your Atomic account
API Secret for your Atomic account

request.description:
# Revoke Access Token

This endpoint is used to revoke an access token generated, which automatically becomes invalid after 30 minutes.

## Header Values

- `x-api-key` - The API key available in the [Console Settings page](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/credentials) under Credentials.
    
- `x-api-secret` - The API secret available in the [Console Settings page](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/credentials) under Credentials.

item.description:
# `AccessToken`

The `/access-token` endpoint is used to create an encrypted token for making calls to the Atomic API from any client side application.

## Use in Postman

All Requests in this collection will run a Test after the Request is sent and a successful response is received. Within the test, a Collection variable `publicToken` is set. This token can then be used as in headers of subsequent API requests in Postman.

## Create TransactUrls

There are several variations of a Request which does a similar thing. They make a call to `/access-token`, then in the Test, the publicToken is stored, and a config object is generated using the publicToken and some of the fields required to instantiate Transact. The config object is then stringified and base64 encoded to generate a TransactUrl. This URL is then stored in both an environment variable and output to the Postman Console. Copy and paste this URL into your browser to launch Transact.

This should serve as a convenient way to test out variations of the config object and provide a means to launch Transact outside of your application.

item.name: Search - query with tags and excludedTags

header.description: The `publicToken` issued from a request to create an `AccessToken`.

item.description:
# `Company`

The `/company/search` endpoint is for providing the search experience for both Atomic and Atomic's customers. You can use this endpoint to build out a search experience if you'd prefer to use a customer UI as opposed to the Atomic experience.

## Options

The search requires a query string at a minimum, but you can also filter the results a few different ways, if that is desired. There are example requests showcasing the filters:

- product
    
- product array - preferred over product for future-proofing
    
- tags array
    
- excludedTags array
    

## Security

Because the search can be run either server side or client side, you have the ability to utilize a `publicToken` or `x-api-key` and `x-api-secret` in the headers to this endpoint.

item.name: Verify
Deposit Accounts

request.description: Searches for a `Company` using a text `query`. Searches can also be narrowed by passing in a specific `product`.

item.description:
# `Verify`

## Deposit Accounts

A `Deposit account`, in the context of the Atomic Financial system, refers to a direct deposit allocation in a payroll system. A deposit account consists of information such as account and routing numbers, type of account, bank name, distribution type, etc.

This information will be synced to the Atomic system when an end user runs a Verify task and allows for this data to be pulled. A snapshot is then stored in Atomic which is what this endpoint then serves. You can pair this with Continuous Access to have the Deposit Accounts checked regularly for any modifications, if that is required for your use case.

### To enable:

You will need to be toggle this feature on in the [Features section of the Settings page of Console](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/features) to be able to work with this data.

item.name: Employment

request.description: Searches for a `Company` using a text `query`. Searches can also be narrowed by passing in a specific `product`.

item.description:
# `Verify`

## Employment

`Employment`, in the context of the Atomic Financial system, refers to the data referring to the end user's employment as it is in the payroll system. This can consist of information such as the type of employment, whether they are actively employed at this particular company, their title, data about the employer, etc.

This information will be synced to the Atomic system when an end user runs a Verify task and allows for this data to be pulled. A snapshot is then stored in Atomic which is what this endpoint then serves. You can pair this with Continuous Access to have the end user's Employment checked regularly for any modifications, if that is required for your use case.

### To enable:

You will need to be toggle this feature on in the [Features section of the Settings page of Console](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/features) to be able to work with this data.

item.name: Identity

request.description: Searches for a `Company` using a text `query`. Searches can also be narrowed by passing in a specific `product`.

item.description:
# `Verify`

## Identity

`Identity`, in the context of the Atomic Financial system, refers to the data containing to the end user's identity as it is in the payroll system. This can consist of information such as first name, last name, DoB, email address, etc.

This information will be synced to the Atomic system when an end user runs a Verify task and allows for this data to be pulled. A snapshot is then stored in Atomic which is what this endpoint then serves. You can pair this with Continuous Access to have the Identity data checked regularly for any modifications, if that is required for your use case.

### To enable:

You will need to be toggle this feature on in the [Features section of the Settings page of Console](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/features) to be able to work with this data.

item.description:
# `Verify`

## Income

`Income`, in the context of the Atomic Financial system, refers to the data containing to the end user's income information as it is in the payroll system. This can consist of data such as income, hourly rate, paycycle, etc.

This information will be synced to the Atomic system when an end user runs a Verify task and allows for this data to be pulled. A snapshot is then stored in Atomic which is what this endpoint then serves. You can pair this with Continuous Access to have the Income data checked regularly for any modifications, if that is required for your use case.

### To enable:

You will need to be toggle this feature on in the [Features section of the Settings page of Console](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/features) to be able to work with this data.

item.name: Statements

request.description: Searches for a `Company` using a text `query`. Searches can also be narrowed by passing in a specific `product`.

item.description:
# `Verify`

## Statements

`Statements`, in the context of the Atomic Financial system, refers to detailed data about the end user's payroll information as it is in the payroll system. This can consist of data such as pay date, payperiod start and end dates, net and gross amounts, deductions, and references to the paystub needed to pull those forms from the Atomic system.

This information will be synced to the Atomic system when an end user runs a Verify task and allows for this data to be pulled. A snapshot is then stored in Atomic which is what this endpoint then serves. You can pair this with Continuous Access to have the Statements data checked regularly for any modifications, if that is required for your use case.

### To enable:

You will need to be toggle this feature on in the [Features section of the Settings page of Console](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/features) to be able to work with this data.

item.name: Taxes

request.description: Searches for a `Company` using a text `query`. Searches can also be narrowed by passing in a specific `product`.

item.description:
# `Verify`

## Taxes

`Taxes`, in the context of the Atomic Financial system, refers to detailed data about the end user's tax data as it is in the payroll system. This can consist of data such as type of tax form available, the tax year, total wages, withholding, codes, and references to the tax forms needed to pull those forms from the Atomic system.

This information will be synced to the Atomic system when an end user runs a Verify task and allows for this data to be pulled. A snapshot is then stored in Atomic which is what this endpoint then serves. You can pair this with Continuous Access to have the Taxes checked regularly for any modifications, if that is required for your use case.

### To enable:

You will need to be toggle this feature on in the [Features section of the Settings page of Console](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/features) to be able to work with this data.

item.name: Timesheets

request.description: Searches for a `Company` using a text `query`. Searches can also be narrowed by passing in a specific `product`.

item.description:
# `Verify`

## Timesheets

`Timesheets`, in the context of the Atomic Financial system, refers to detailed data about the end user's timesheet data as it is in the payroll system. This can consist of data such as whether the timesheet has been paid out, duration, date, and clocked in and out times.

This information will be synced to the Atomic system when an end user runs a Verify task and allows for this data to be pulled. A snapshot is then stored in Atomic which is what this endpoint then serves. You can pair this with Continuous Access to have the Timesheet data checked regularly for any modifications, if that is required for your use case.

### To enable:

You will need to be toggle this feature on in the [Features section of the Settings page of Console](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/features) to be able to work with this data.

# Verify

This folder contains API flows relating to the Atomic Financial UserLink product and it's use cases.

More details are available on the documentation page of each of the folders within.

item.name: Create a Transact URL - Verify Linked Account

header.description: API Key for your Atomic account
API Secret for your Atomic account

request.description:
## Usage

This endpoint makes a call to `/access-token` to create a publicToken using a LinkedAccount.

The Test in this Request then grabs the publicToken from the Response, stringifies and base64 encodes a config object, and builds a URL. This URL can be used to instantiate Transact using the associated LinkedAccount. It is printed to the Postman Console and stored in the `transactUrlWithToken`environment variable. Copy and paste this string into the URL bar of a browser to launch Transact.

This is very useful for testing variations of the config object and using LinkedAccounts outside of your application.

item.description:
# `Continuous Access`

## Linked Account

A `Linked Account` refers to the logical container in the Atomic system which holds the necessary data for Atomic to maintain the persistent connection.  

When Linked Accounts are enabled in your Atomic instance, each time a user successfully authenticates through Transact, a new Linked Account is created in Atomic. This will have a `linkedAccount._id` which is how you will be able to use this persistent connection.

When the scheduled job is run for a LinkedAccount, if a difference from the last run for that LinkedAccount is detected, a snapshot of the data is taken and a webhook is sent out to any endpoints listening for the relevant webhooks. The data snapshot will also replace the data which is available via a call to the corresponding API endpoint.

# `Continuous Access`

This folder contains API flows relating to the Atomic Financial Continuous Access product and it's use cases.

Continuous Access refers to the Atomic product in which a user or employer grants permission for Atomic to maintain a persistent connection to a payroll system in order to monitor for updates to the state of the payroll system. Depending on the data being accessed, there are varying schedules with which Atomic reverifies the data on-file. If a change is detected, then the snapshot in the Atomic system is updated and the correlating webhooks are sent out. This new snapshot of data is what will be available when the corresponding API is hit to retrieve the data.

There is also an API to trigger a check of the data on-demand.

item.name: Task
item.description:
# `Task`

A `Task` refers to the unit of work in the Atomic system which begins with a successful authentication of an end user in a payroll system. This folder contains API endpoints to provide functionality around the Tasks which your users instatiate in the Atomic system.

### Task status

This endpoint returns the status of a Task as well as the fail reason if the Task was unsuccessful. See the [Docs](https://docs.atomicfi.com/reference/webhooks#tasks__task-failures) for more detail on the various `failReason`s. The required Task `_id`can be found in several of the interaction events emitted in Transact or in the Task related webhooks sent out when Task events occur in the Atomic system.

### Task prescreen

This endpoint serves to provide a predicted conversion confidence for a provided company going through the Atomic Verify flow. This endpoint will need to be enabled by your Customer Service Manager.

### Generate a file URL

Many uses cases, especially Verify use cases, require PDFs or other documents to be downloaded to your system. This endpoint is the means to do just that. When these files are received from the payroll system, Atomic generates a presigned URL which can be used to retrieve the document. These URLs are only available for 1 hour. Hitting this endpoint with the TaskId and the fileId - sent out via the corresponding webhooks when Atomic received the document - generates a new URL and starts the clock over at 1 hour so that the document can be retrieved.

request.description:
### Put User details for PayLink Tasks

This endpoint is used to update user information.

#### Request Body

- `identifier` (string) - The identifier for the user.
    
- `data` (object)
    
    - `cards` (array)
        
        - `title` (string) - The title of the card.
            
        - `number` (string) - The card number.
            
        - `expiry` (string) - The expiry date of the card.
            
        - `cvv` (string) - The CVV of the card.
            

#### Response

The response is in JSON format with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "type": "",
  "message": "",
  "data": {
    "errors": [""]
  }
}

 ```

# Get JWE Secrets This endpoint is used to get the allocate JSON Web Encryption Secret for a customer within the associated environment. #### Request - Method: GET - [URL: https://api.atomicfi.com/secrets/jwe-public-keys](https://api.atomicfi.com/secrets/jwe-publi)

# Delete Webhook Endpoint

This endpoint is used to delete a specific webhook endpoint by providing the `endpointId` in the URL path.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

##### Success Response

``` json
{
    "success": true
}

 ```

header.description: API Key for your Atomic account
API Secret for your Atomic account

request.description:
# Get Health Check

This endpoint sends a GET request to `{{apiUrl}}/health` to perform a health check of the system.

## Header Values

- `x-api-key` - The API key for authentication
    
- `x-api-secret` - The API secret for authentication
    

These values can be found in the [Console Settings page](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/credentials) under Credentials.

## Header Values

- `x-api-key` - The API key for authentication.
    
- `x-api-secret` - The API secret for authentication.
    

These values can be found in the [Console Settings page](https://console.atomicfi.com/settings/credentials) under Credentials.

## Response

Upon successful execution, the API returns a status code of 200 and the content type is `application/json`. The response body contains the health status in the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "checks": [
        {
            "name": "",
            "state": "",
            "data": {
                "reason": ""
            }
        }
    ]
}

 ```

The `status` field indicates the overall health status, and the `checks` array provides detailed information about individual health checks. Each check includes a `name`, `state`, and `data` object with a `reason` field.

This request does not require a request body as it is a GET request.
